intro: Echium cantabricum, commonly known as the Cantabrian thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its tall, spiny stems and purple to pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its medicinal and ornamental uses. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Echium cantabricum thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
